paper_abstract: Let 1 <= p < infinity be any fixed real. We show that assuming P not equal NP, it is hard to approximate the Minimum Solutions of Linear Diophantine Equations in l(p) norm within any constant factor and it is also hard to approximate the Minimum Solutions of Linear Diophantine Equations in l(p) norm within the factor n(c)/log log(n) for some constant c > 0 where n is the number of variables in the equations. paper_title: Hardness of approximating the minimum solutions of linear diophantine equations
